SENT.plain: BACKGROUND: Spontaneous dissection of the vertebral artery is uncommon

RESULTS: We report a 49-year-old woman who presented with the rapidly progressing basilar artery syndrome who was given an intravenous dose of tissue plasminogen activator seven hours after the onset of first symptoms
Thirty minutes after the injection, a dramatic recovery of the patient's consciousness and neurological signs was noted
CONCLUSION: To our knowledge, this is the first reported case of intravenous tissue plasminogen activator use in acute vertebral artery dissection
